name: Becs Gentry
caption: Walking the finish line of this years NYC Marathon was emotional. I didn’t expect it to wash over me in such a way. Taking Tallulah to Central Park was a must over marathon weekend. However for me, in that moment as I reflected on my 2019 NYC marathon race I felt the importance that day held for my life. I discovered the real me during that run, I fell hopelessly in love, I believed I could do things I had previously doubted my ability to do, I showed up and completed the job at hand that day with one of the biggest smiles possible. Those 26.2 miles in 2019 changed my life both personally and professionally. As I looked at Tallulah and Austin in the moment as we approached the finish straight, tears flowed. Tears of happiness and pride for myself, and for my little family and where we are three years down the line.

name: Becs Gentry
caption: Last week we spent 6 nights  @boramcare  🧡 it was filled with rest, recovery and education around all things in the life of new-parents and a newborn. From nutritionist designed meals for moms to a baby CPR course and lactation consultations, Boram has a great deal to offer new parents, we certainly left feeling ready to get home and immerse ourselves in these new life roles.  Stay tuned to find out more and see exactly just how  @austinjcurtis  and I were able to pop out to cheer on everyone running NYC Marathon!

name: Becs Gentry
caption: My first baby, and yes he may be getting a little less snuggles at home but I rest assured his health is always looked after thanks to  @meetwagmo  🐾 From wellness visits to those dreaded emergency room trips, I am fully confident Wagmo has our back and will continue to keep us all smiling.

name: Becs Gentry
caption: Finding out I was pregnant was a juxtaposition of extreme joy and fear. Having been through a miscarriage before I somehow didn’t trust my body. However my first signs of pregnancy were different this time, my  @ouraring  actually noticed ahead of me, showing high resting heart rate and elevated body temperature at night. When it reminded my period should have arrived was when I was prompted to take a test. Having technology measuring our body’s output is often solely associated with fitness and performance, and prior to pregnancy that was my main focus. During my pregnancy journey, however, I leant on my Oura Ring more than I could have imagined, from logging how I was sleeping to understanding how the effects of my training was changing. Learning about my body is a passion and I’m very grateful to part of the Oura family, continuing my education and I am so excited to see how my body reacts to coming back to training…when it’s ready!    #withoura   #ourapartner

name: Ben Alldis
caption: As I close out a weekend full of celebrations for my 4 year anniversary at  @onepeloton , I wanted to take a moment to say thank you🙏🏽 - Thank you everyone who has taken workouts with me across the last 4 years - Thank you for believing in the vision that we at Peloton are continuing to build to change the face of fitness and wellness for all - Thank you for your continued commitment to my coaching and openness to taking on new coaching lessons that I share both in and out of class  - Thank you for being my constant source of positive energy through the highs and lows of life and through the support you show me and the rest of the instructors on socials and in studio - Thank you for the continued love you show one another within this community🙌🏽 We truly have something incredibly special going on within the  @onepeloton  community and if the last 4 years is any indication of how powerful fitness can be on so many peoples lives, I am nothing but excited for what is in store for us all in next 4 and beyond! Here’s to continuing to pour good energy into this community that keeps on giving and creating better lives for ourselves and our loved ones around us🙌🏽 #TogetherWeGoFar   #OnePeloton

name: Ben Alldis
caption: This weekend marks 4 years that  @leannehainsby  and I have officially been Peloton instructors 🎉  Through the highs and the lows of life, this job and this community has been a constant source of positive energy and fulfilment for us. When we signed our contracts to join this company, we were both taking a massive leap of faith. Switching industries and lifestyles for an opportunity that was a gamble, but that just felt right at the time for us both and it’s fair to say it’s been one of the best decisions we ever made. We are grateful for the continued love and support from all of you and can’t wait to keep building and growing alongside you all🙏🏽 10s of collaborations 1000s of workouts filmed 10,000s of belters & bangers played 100,000s member milestones 1,000,000s of member workouts We are so proud of what we and you all have achieved across this last 4 years and we can’t wait to see what lies ahead. We will be celebrating all weekend with classes from the London studio, so hope you can join! My class schedule below: Saturday: 30min Climb Ride  Sunday: 30min 80s Ride Monday: 20min Upper Body Strength See you there friends! 🙌🏽

caption: The tan will fade, but the memories will last forever ! . The trip to Australia is hard to put into words. It was definitely a journey to myself. name: Callie Gullickson
caption: This is Charlie. She thinks I’m a real life fitness princess & insisted on seeing me when visiting her family here in New York. I asked her why we work out and she said to get stronger 🥹 and it was that exact moment I realized that I’m doing what I feel like I was meant to do. All the times I doubted, compared and disliked myself were necessary in order for me to find my confidence, my energy and outlook on myself, others and LIFE. And fitness was the catapult. My goal is to inspire women (of all ages) to embrace who they are & feel fabulous about themselves so they can experience the joy I felt once I stopped trying to be perfect and starting being ME! We lift weights to get stronger (we know how heavy those Trader Joe’s bags can be),build our confidence and set our energy so we can change the narrative for future generations. Working out isn’t to look a certain way it’s to feel a certain way. So we can go out into the world and be the best version of ourselves not just for us but for others… for little girls like Charlie. On that note, don’t forget to ✨BYOE☀️I love you all. Grateful for  @onepeloton

name: Camila Ramon
caption: Argentina is one of the countries with the biggest sizing discrepancies in the world. In a country with multiple eating disorder epidemics, the only thing this does is continue to entertain the narrative that leads to harmful habits in girls, adolescents & women.  Bad Bunny’s Dancers (athletes), made a video on Tik Tok casually highlighting this, not realizing the conversations it would spark, and i’m grateful for that. I’ve personally talking a lot more with friends about our experiences amidst the  #heroinchic  stunt. It was personally very triggering for someone who in the past struggles with their body image.  When I went to argentina I visited a couple stores with an average-sized family member looking for PJ’s and we could not find any that fit.  @anybodyargentina  has been working diligently to pass a sizing law in Argentina that went through but is not being implemented. Follow them to learn more & remember to continue having important conversations in your home & with your girls. We can do better & we won’t go back.   #leydetalles   #argentina   #bodyimage   #bodypositive

name: Chelsea Jackson Roberts
caption: Ain’t nothing more humbling than returning to something you once did everyday and starting that thing for the first day 🥹 It will be 10 weeks tomorrow (not to mention the 9 months before) that I’ve devoted my ALL to another human being. It is truly the highest honor to bring Noble into this world by the Grace of all that is holy AND ….chileeeeee, it feels so good to {re} connect to my body in a way that I’m devoted to me and no one else. This is by no means a “follow my SnapBack” post; instead, this is an I AM SO GRATEFUL FOR THIS BODY AND ALL THAT IS CAN DO Post.  Before even having Noble I knew that I wanted to set an example for him to carve out space and time for what he and his body needs. Sending love to anyone who is picking up where they left off on a previous goal. ✨ I am grateful to have to space and time to take a 20 minute hike with my girl  @joslynthompsonrule  ❤️ How do you stay motivated to reach a goal when life tells you that you don’t have time? #FourthTrimester #PostPartumWorkOut

name: Chelsea Jackson Roberts
caption: You don’t need a ton of time to practice meditation daily. Your meditation practice can be as accessible as closing your eyes, taking a few deep breaths; or even mindful steps/movements out in the world.  Today Noble and I got some fresh air in our neighborhood and I was able to practice mindfulness by being present with my family.  What are some ways you practice meditation through your lived experiences? Remember, meditation can be simply the practice of being present. In what ways do you practice being present?

Ohio.  Noble Antoine Roberts, you are really loved…. Loved generations before you were even created.  #HeMadeMeAMom #RainbowBaby #FourthTrimester

name: Chelsea Jackson Roberts
caption: One of my favorite things to do as a new mom has been exploring our Harlem neighborhood with baby Noble. ☺️  My parenthood plan with my husband has always included understanding our health, our community, and the power we have to impact change. Many of you know that I have always been vocal about the inequities I have experienced, observed, and even studied as an educational researcher.  This is why I am proud to partner with the  @AllofUsResearch  Program, which is gathering health data from one million or more people living in the United States to accelerate research that may improve health.  Learn how you can make your voice count by visiting allof-us.org/join-now #AllOfUsPartner #BlackMom

name: Christine D'Ercole
caption: SOMETHING REALLY SPECIAL IS HAPPENING TODAY! . 🙌In todays 30min Power Zone ride at 3pm eastern /8pm gmt, rider Jo Vogeli will complete riding the final 2.85 of 4,536 MILES on her Peloton, live in studio. This is the distance between her home and her friend Elissa Baskind  #luekemiawarrior  in Leeds UK, as she goes through treatment. They met on the Leaderboard- after noticing that they often took the same rides and rode at the same pace. They connected over the interwebs and became dear friends. And today, a whole crew is riding together, with hands on each others backs in support. So here is what I hope you take away from this-  You never know what the person before you, beside you, behind you, is carrying. Everyone at some point could use a hand on their back. If we can carry this mindful awareness into our everydayness, we may find more moments of peace in our lives, and we may create more peace in the lives of others. And in this- we create community. THIS is what the Peloton I ride in is about. THIS is what turns the leaderboard into the Community Board.  THIS is what the company I came to 8 years ago is about. So if you’re looking for a place to ride away from the noise of the world, we got you. EDIT: PS Elissa is also riding on three week old double hip replacement today. #whatifyoucan . #iamicaniwillido   #onepeloton   #handsonyourback   #luekemia   #healing   #cycling   #miles   #support   #powerzone

caption: THIS IS A BIG DEAL. My friend Maggie is racing against the FASTEST women in the WORLD at a brand new Track Cycling series in Europe. name: Christine D'Ercole
caption: Yesterday I got to tell stories to a wonderful group of women at  @crayola   The Womens Interest Network (WIN) at Crayola was created in 2006 with a mission of helping women improve overall leadership and networking skills to gain a greater degree of personal esteem and self-confidence. Wordshop was a perfect way to bring together this community who, up til yesterday, had not met in person for 3 years because of the pandemic. The most powerful thing anyone can say to us is what we say to ourselves. I AM resilient I CAN recover I WILL show up I DO thrive Thank you so much Crayola for having me. WORDSHOP - a workshop in self-talk, is practical and powerful tool for changing our story, one word at a time. For more information click link in BIO Next wordshop is GRATITUDE 11/22/22 5:30pm et Register at christinedercole.com #iamicaniwillido   #changeyourchatter   #wordshop   #selftalk   #innermonologue   #selfcare   #agency   #storytelling   #handsonyourback

name: Christine D'Ercole
caption: What’s your favorite color? 🖍 Tomorrow I get to speak at  @crayola  🖍🖍 This will be the Crayola’s Women’s Interest Network’s first in-person gathering since March 2020. Wow. We are going to talk about the power of being present, of being in one another’s presence. We are going to talk about the importance of genuine community and of being seen.  We are going to talk about how the pandemic has impacted our inner monologue and how we can manage that self-talk for good. . And, we are going to PLAY WITH CRAYONS. . Looking forward  to seeing you all tomorrow. PS My favorite color is Midnight Teal.  Is that a crayon color? Maybe it should be 🖍 PPS Fun Fact: our wedding photographer snapped the second pic in our engagement shoot in front of the Crayola Experience. I had no idea until we saw the photos that he included the crayon guy.  I thought that was playful.  And brilliant. For more about WORDSHOP: workshops in self-talk, please see link in bio or go to christinedercole.com . #iamicaniwillido   #wordshop   #changeyourchatter   #creativity   #crayola   #play

name: Hannah Frankson
caption: Time to formally reintroduce myself. My name is Hannah Frankson and I am your UK bike AND tread Peloton Instructor.  Please understand, long distance running is something I did not do in my past. I was into short sharp quick things. This is a new adventure and the timing feels right to run again in a completely new capacity. This will be challenging but like I’ve said on the bike I’m happy to aim for the moon and land amongst the stars. We will be in this together crew ✨ Massive thank you to my new tread teammates for rolling through and to  @becsgentry  and  @austincagley  for training me through this process 🥵  My next run is Wednesday 23rd at 7am UK time. 30min Intervals Run, let’s go 💪🏽 WHO IS READY TO RUN! 🏃🏽‍♀️

name: Hannah Frankson
caption: They say your vibe attracts your tribe..if that’s true, I got a bunch of messy, real, hard working no behaviour individuals with me 😂 Thank you for letting me be me on a bike for three years. We’ve pushed through hard times and fun times together and I’m sure there will be more of both. The power and joy that we can experience through connecting with other humans quite literally can help give us LIFE so once again, thank you ❤️ to the PPC and anyone that has ever done a ride with me.  Now let’s get to running 👀

name: Jenn Sherman
caption: ⁣ When members come to PSNY, part of the experience for them is “spotting” their favorite instructors coming in or out of the studio. I have made the analogy that walking around PSNY is kind of like being at Disney. You never know which of your favorite Pelostars you might see. ⁣ ⁣ I can actually relate. Because that’s how it feels for me every time I walk into the instructor dressing room. Yes, I “see” my teammates regularly on Zoom calls but some of us can go weeks (even months) without crossing paths at the studio, in real time, FACE TO FACE. These beautiful humans made my Sunday and then some. So much love for my  #pelofam . ⁣ ⁣ P.S. Back to back Saturday/Sunday hugs with  @tune2tunde  ?  YES, PLEASE !

name: Jenn Sherman
caption: The Daylight Savings Slump is a beast, but over the years I’ve learned how to keep myself from letting it get to me.  👊🏻 I stay on top of my workouts, curl up with a good book, take a nice bath on cold nights, and reach for something delish like  @halotopcreamery  when I want something sweet.  😋 My friends at  @halotopcreamery  want to help us all  #LightenUp  during the post time-change weeks, so they’re encouraging us along with a very fun sweepstakes for a chance to win a trip to Rio de Janeiro ☀️ , free Halo Top pints, and more.  Give them a follow, and head to www.halotoplightenup.com to enter!  You have until the 20th to try your luck out.  🤞🏻 While you’re at it, drop any tips you have for making the shorter days brighter.  We’re in this together!👇🏻🙌🏻👊🏻 #halotop   #halotopcreamery   #lightenup

caption: Reduce the external noise and increase the volume on your internal thoughts. How do you fuel your focus? name: Jess King
caption: 1 week with our Luz 💛❤️‍🔥 and time is flying. I’ve made it a point to reframe my postpartum experience – It’s not hard, it’s new, and with every new experience comes a learning curve.  -I’m meeting each moment with grace and an abundance of patience and gratitude.  -I am hyper aware of frustration or stress, from myself or anyone around me, and maintain a strong boundary of bliss around my body and my baby.  -I’m in absolute awe of my body and the bond Lucien and I are creating. -I’m even more in love with  @sophiaurista  than I’ve ever been. Thank you for everything. You are the best Mami. 💕💕 -And finally, I bow to the team of people who are loving and supporting our family through this transition. 🙏🏼 Yay, 1 week Papito Mio. Te quiero con todo mi corazón❣️

name: Jess Sims
caption: 11.2.22 = FOUR YEARS OF PELOTON ✅ DONE! (and 400 more to go 🥰) to everyone who has ever taken my class - thank you. For giving me a safe space to be myself, to make mistakes, to learn, to ruin songs 😈, to lift heavy shit, to evolve, to laugh, and to do hard things. What we do is so much deeper than fitness. I will never stop believing this. It’s showing ourselves that what we want in life isn’t impossible, it’s just hard. So hell yea the workouts are tough, but we are tougher…together.  @onepeloton  is a team sport! Let’s keep amplifying the positive and showing up for ourselves so that we can continue to make valuable contributions to this world we live and the people we come into contact with each day ❤️ more life, more IMPACT.

name: Joslyn Thompson Rule
caption: Literally no one has a clue at the start! 👏🏽NO👏🏽ONE👏🏽 Yes Barbara is doing awesome now, but Barbara felt exactly like you on her first day of (insert new vibe for you). Maybe Barbara actually felt worse!  Maybe Barbara backed out several times before her day one.  Knowing what it is we need to do is great, but we don’t really learn it until we apply it, and at the start it can be a shit show.  Like a really big one.  Why am I doing this again?  My first home-visit personal training session.  Sweet Lordt, I fumbled my way through, trying to come up with moves.  The bride-to-be had no words.  None.  Didn’t get the call back.  My first group training session.  Last minute cover (said yes cos I was new and she begged) unimpressed glares, as I apologised my way through the session “Is Claire back next week?” No beat count, transitioning terribly.  Awful! ⠀ But we move!  So keep going loves!

name: Joslyn Thompson Rule
caption: The rule of thirds and the people in your life👇🏽 I love different applications of the rule of thirds, especially this one from  @reesewitherspoon  - I spoke about in my Hip Hop walk: ▪️1/3 of the people in your life want to bring you down and are happy to see you fail. ▪️1/3 of the people in your life are indifferent to you, they can take you or leave you but are mostly not bothered by you (rude.) ▪️1/3 of the people in your life will lift you up, be happy to see you thrive and have their hand firmly on your back. Know who those people are for you.  Avoid the first (if you can, but know who they are 👀 so you can exercise boundaries); don’t yearn for the second, we like to be liked but it’s ok, we are never going to be for everybody; and hold dear the third, even when you’re having a moment, they are still there for you!  Note too, that just as we change, others do too.  People move categories, and we will too.  Release what you don’t need and embrace new connections, but know that they all co-exist in our lives at the same time.

name: Joslyn Thompson Rule

name: Joslyn Thompson Rule
caption: You cannot commit to growth and hold yourself to a standard of perfection at the same time.  As a former perfectionist, the following ideas have helped me: 1️⃣ something always gives (6 plates spinning, drop one or two, we move) 2️⃣ done is better than perfect (so much time wasted here) Nobody needs to get why you’re doing what you’re doing.  And they probably won’t.  But you do.  You especially need to, when you get distracted worrying about what other people think; or people are questioning your methods; or you have failed and feel embarrassed; or you’re sitting in moments of doubt/insecurity/fatigue/questioning why you even started? All of the above happen on repeat as you grow.  That is guaranteed.  You don’t need to embrace it, it sucks, but you do have to face it - no amount of perfectionism will protect you from that.  Messy action and moving with an intent to learn (from failings/mistakes), has always been a vibe! ✌🏽

name: Joslyn Thompson Rule
caption: What do I do with my feet in a lunge? Great question... To feel where your feet should be: 1️⃣ Start in a tall kneeling position  2️⃣ Step forward into half-kneeling and mark where both feet are placed on the floor 3️⃣ Stand up into a split squat (the static position of a lunge in terms of foot placement) and see how that feels to move in and out of. (In the video I need to bring the back foot in a little as it didn’t feel quite comfortable - the half kneeling position gives you an idea of starting point, but readjust as you need with feel). It then takes practise to feel what feels comfortable for you.  The dowel rod is a great way to practise the position and get some repetition in, so you can familiarise yourself with how the movement feels.  Over time, you will naturally fall into your foot position without having to think about it, but allow yourself the practise if needed.  Other useful points are: ▪️stance width, is roughly hip-width apart (this should ideally happen due to you starting in the half kneeling position)  ▪️in forward lunges, drive back off the front heel, not the toes.  ▪️warm up well, ahead of lunges, they demand a lot of the body.  In terms of complexity: split squats < reverse lunge < forward lunge  Take your time building competence in each one, there’s no rush, and remember, more complex, does not mean better, it just means more complex (jump lunges etc. add in more complexity again)  Play around with all of these positions - we all have different limb lengths and bodies.  Explore and familiarise yourself with the movement of yours.  If lunges come up in a workout, do the variation that meets your body where it’s at.  Do you have a favourite?

name: Joslyn Thompson Rule
caption: In case you think I’m all love and light as I bang on about recovery, it’s because I want you to fuck shit up if you choose to, and you don’t have to, ever, but if you want to, give yourself the option. The reality is, if you’re pushing hard every session, you’re not actually pushing hard at all, your body doesn’t work like that.  If the tank is empty and you’re still pushing, you’re working in a deficit, and of course that will feel like hard work.  It’s important that you know the difference between working hard on empty, and moving at an intensity that you can only get to when you have recuperated smartly - both are uncomfortable. Only one will move you forward.  Seeing what your body can do is incredible!  That capacity for everyone is different, we all have different goals/intentions.  For some it’s moving at a low intensity often; for others it’s maxing out and seeing what your body can do once or twice per week as part of a wider  programme.  One is not better than the other, but if the latter is yours, recovery is your best friend so that you can really go to that place.  Happy Friday loves ✌🏽

name: Joslyn Thompson Rule
caption: If you’re not feeling quite 100% but still want to work out, here are some options.  Just to be clear, if you are sick, take a rest, your recovery is important and the workout can wait.  If however you feel a little under the weather, or not quite 100% and would still like to move, here are some options.  1. Complete rest - again, if you are sick, get better.  2. Reduce the intensity at which you’re working by reducing any of the following- ▪️time ▪️distance ▪️speed ▪️weight ▪️reps ▪️sets and, or increasing rest periods.  3. Ditching the workout and opting for some form of movement that meets you were you are at ▪️walking ▪️stretching ▪️mobility ▪️yoga (many of these can be intense too, so choose wisely) If you can’t do the programme/workout/class in front of you, but you still want to move and it’s not going to impede your health any further, adapt.  This also goes for if you’re short on time or your day doesn’t quite go to plan.  You had hoped for a 30 minute workout, but now you only have 20.  You have twenty minutes to still move, or fifteen or ten.  Something is always better than nothing, unless it’s much needed rest; and in that case, nothing is a full mood ✌🏽

name: Kendall Toole
caption: ✨🎄 ITS THE MOST WONDERFUL TIME OF THE YEAR 🙏 As the holidays kick off and the joy of decorating settles in I want to politely remind you… ✨be KIND— through insane parking lot traffic, long lines, stressed workers etc.  ✨be EMPATHETIC- for many, this time of year can strike up deep emotional feelings of loss, longing, loneliness as for many there will be empty chairs at tables. This is the season of giving—- give your love and your heart to those who need a little extra support this year ✨be of SERVICE- if you can count your blessings you can count the ways you can turn around and help others. SHARE your time, your abundance, your presence with those in need. For many the best gift in life is being seen and reminded that you too, matter. Commit to at least a few days of service to those in need ❤️ ✨ be PRESENT- if one thing is certain, time flies and it’s never promised. Take time for your mental health and your heart to be connected to those you love. Phones/ social media < MEMORIES and true CONNECTION  May you all kick off the holiday season with all of the above…the world needs your light. Share it in spades. ❤️✨ #holidays   #christmastime   #xmas2022   #mindfulholidays

name: Kendall Toole
caption: 🥂 no-drink November! 🥂✨ ⚡️CHALLENGE: From Nov 4th to the end of the month (Dec 1) I am committing to no alcoholic beverages and will be exploring the world of mocktails and NA-alternatives! ✨WHY? Candidly because I’m kinda over it. I’ve noticed even a lil bit of alcohol effects my sleep, throws off my gut biome, and the killer…totally increases my anxiety and depletes my appetite!  ⚡️THE PURPOSE: There’s so much 😱 stigma 😱 about choosing not to drink (“oh you must have a problem”, “but how will you have fun and be social?”, “your life will be boring without it…” etc.) and I want to dismantle those silly perspectives and do a little experiment to see how I feel with 28 days of no alcohol!  ⚡️THE GOAL: as someone currently studying nutrition and always looking for information on protecting and optimizing our brain function I want to take this time to experiment on the body I know best, my OWN, and see how opting for non-alcoholic alternatives effects different  I’ll be sharing mocktail recipes, honest reviews, and self check-ins with you all both here and on Tik Tok!  ✨⚡️Comment below if you wanna join in and explore cheersing a bit *differently* into the final months of the year! ✨🥂  #sobercurious   #nodrinknovember   #nonalcoholic   #mocktail   #drinkofchoice

name: Kirra Michel
caption: When it feels like you’re drowning… stop.  Take a step back.  Sometimes we’re too close to the situation to see it clearly.  Move. Your body. Get lost in it. The music and the movements. Flow.  Breathe. Clean air. Around trees, lakes, rivers or oceans. A body of water is more healing than I can express to you.  Take your shoes off and be in nature. Grass. Dirt. Mud. Sand. Between your toes.  Lay in the grass or sand and watch the stars. Be in awe of the vastness of it all.  Listen to Kirtan. Or anything that touches your heart, brining you joy and deep devotion to something within and beyond you.  Spend time alone. Meditate. Listen.  Or be around your people. Supportive and loving people. The ones who celebrate you and hold space for you. Love them back with your whole heart. Listen.  Be of service to others. Always.  Love. Yourself. And others.  ✨💙 Cover shot by  @vandyphotography  🙏🏼

name: Kirra Michel
caption: Sit me down and let me talk about yoga and meditation 🧘🏼‍♀️ please. It’s my happy place. I can get lost and go on tangents about how these practices have touched my soul. How I started off loathing yoga and meditation, and wanting nothing to do with them. I flatly rejected them.  Especially coming from a family and a community that practiced both.  I love getting to share this part of my journey. The part of where my loathing slowly become a full deep and proud loving respect for these lifesaving practices, their roots and lineages.  And how they have done just that, saved my life. ✨ I had the opportunity to dive into a little of this story and explain a little more about meditation at  @onepeloton  Sydney, Australia in October. I got to chat with the stunning and inspiring  @jesinta_franklin  and the Aussie Manager, Amanda at a media event.  I love that I can teach and share my practices with not only people in the states, but thanks to  @onepeloton , all over the world, including home sweet home! 🇦🇺 And for those of you who don’t know, yes, you can buy or rent a bike. But you don’t have to. You can download the app and have access to all the yoga and meditation classes, strength, boxing, outdoor running, walking, Pilates and more on your phone.

name: Kirra Michel
caption: More MOBILITY ✨ Thanks to  @littletfitness  for the routine (after leg day 😂🥵) People constantly tell me that I makes movement look easy (I actually disagree with this specific routine) BUT, the only reason something ‘looks easy’ is because of how much work, how many hours and how much dedication has gone into working towards the specific destination/goal.  Good things take time, require a ton of dedication & determination, consistency and patience. Whether it’s hand, balancing, mobility, yoga, meditation, philosophy, self growth or whatever you’re working towards.  One of my favourite Sutras from The Yoga Sutras of Patanjali is 1.14;  Practice becomes firming grounded when well attended to for a long time, without break, and in all earnestness.  So if it doesn’t come across as ‘easy’, keep working at it. Regress it. Break it down. Make it easier. Create a solid foundation of strength and flexibility and build from there.  How long does it take? Well, the real question is, how much time are you willing to put into it?  2 years training 1 or 2 times a day is different than 2 years training once or twice a week.  Then you have to ask how important is said thing… how much time are you willing to dedicate towards it.  And last thing, find people who inspire you. Don’t be intimated, be inspired and let them help drive you ✨ Sooooo… give it a go. Break it down. Share and tag me! 🙏🏼 #mobility   #pistolsquat   #dragonsquat

name: Kirra Michel
caption: Ice baths is where it’s at my friends. ❄️❄️❄️ There’s a TON of amazing reasons you all ‘should’ be diving into these dreaded tubs….Yes, I fully dread it BEFORE I go for it. I contemplate leaving and doing a sneaky Irish exit (my favs 😂) but I know how good Ill feel after, and I make myself stay. I know the aftermath means more mental clarity, I tend to be emotionally lighter, and feel physically accomplished. I also remind myself that it’s good to do hard things. Humans are strong as hell and sometimes we forget it.  But my favourite part is when you first get in and EVERY SINGLE part of your body and mind is screaming GET OUT!! And rather than giving in to the stress response, you tame it and teach it to be calm in a stressful situation….and within a number of seconds, you can calm yourself down, ‘chill’ ❄️, and maybe even have a laugh.  It also helps if you have good people around you.  @avilu  and   @laurenschrammfit  are some amazing humans who coach breath work and ice baths (amongst other awesome things) for a living. Check ‘me out. Follow them. Do an ice bath session with them. Thank you later 😋 And thanks  @shiro_tani_  for being my partner in crime. Who else would be down to do this with me?!?!

name: Kirra Michel
caption: Fresh new week….  Let’s go get it  Do you schedule your workouts ahead of time?  If so, what workouts // movement classes do you have planned for the week?  Do you have an accountability // workout partner to help you encourage you along the way?  (It’s super helpful for the days you don’t feel like moving. This morning was a struggle for me, and grateful to my trainer who got me through it).  So grab a friend, and plan your movement for the week. Focus Flow: Wheel  FRI:  10:30am EST - 45 mins Int. Power Slow Flow  ✨🖤🤘🏼

name: Kirra Michel
caption: Instead of shaming, berating and hating all my shadows, I’m trying really fucking hard to learn how to love and accept them as part of my journey….and me.  My human journey.  My shadows are real, and very evident, and so loud at times. They’re some of my best and most challenging lessons I’ve been given. And perhaps one day I’ll be able to say ‘gifted’ with.  Working to accept my totality. Not just my bright and easy parts. ✨🖤 ….it’s a long journey.

name: Kirra Michel
caption: No obstacles… Only terrain. And it’s in this terrain I loose myself. Find joy. Frustration. Explore and listen. Sometimes ignore. Get enraged, self berate, become aware and self sooth, and finally let the debris settle and feel grounded. Return back to me. My knowing…. Only to do it all over again. It’s a cycle. Of life. Of nature. Of learning and unlearning. Unbecoming. Of knowing nothing. Of being nothing but a flesh suit pretending to know more than we do. What even is life…? but events and moments and emotions strung together miraculously by a fine golden thread. Magic. And insignificant. Everything. And nothing. ✨

name: Kirra Michel
caption: When home sickness sets in…  The hardest part of living on the other side of the world is not being with my family. Not hugging these guys and not being present to watch the little ones grow up.  When I left, both my niece and nephew asked me not to go, and my heart shattered. I broke down crying as the car pulled away with their faces in the rear view mirror. My brother is my rock. He always has been. Literally the best human being I know. His wife and kids are my heart. And my Mumma (Babs) has a heart of gold. And her pup… oh wow I fell in love with her three legged toy poodle Molly. Molly was going to be killed because she was born with 3 legs. Mumma heard about it and stopped that from happening. And thank goodness cause that pup is pure joy.  🤍

name: Kristin McGee
caption: Sharing these for many reasons!  1. Strengthening the glutes also helps with strengthening the pelvic floor. 2. These are effective & efficient (can also be done without the band). 3. Stronger glutes help support the back. 4. If you’re hyper mobile (like me) it’s equally important to strengthen and not just stretch (as much as I love to lie in pigeon all day!) 5. Strength training is key as we get older. 6. These moves (single leg ones especially) get us stronger for our 🏃🏼‍♀️  15-20 reps of the single leg exercises 30 reps of the bridges 2-3 sets. Let’s go!!! PS who else works out in their bathroom? 🤣 squeeze it in when and where you can!

name: Kristin McGee
caption: Lucky loves my ✨Tuesday Tips✨! This one is for the IT band (that band of fascia that runs along your outer thigh). When it’s tight, it can pull on the knee.  I love doing Fallen Warrior to stretch out the area. You can also try fallen warrior on your back and use a strap to target that area.  Make sure to breathe deeply and try and hold for 45-60 seconds (or more) on each side. Drop a 💙 if this is helpful or even better tag a friend who has a tight IT! (🏃🏼‍♀️ often do)

name: Kristin McGee
caption: Hip hip hooray! Today’s hip opening class  @onepeloton  is one of my favs! Here’s two ways to open your hips using a wall. The wall is great because it doesn’t let us cheat. The first variation try and get the small of your back up against the wall.  The second variation make sure your pelvis is staying even. Hold for 5-8 breaths on each side. These are great to do post run or ride and before bed at night.  My lower back is so much happier when I open my hips. Drop a 💖 if you agree!

Whenever you see cool braids or curls she’s the one who’s done them!!! She is always someone I can rely on. I honestly couldn’t do what I do if it weren’t for her. To say we are blessed is an understatement! Happy Bday 🎉 Damarist I hope the gifts keep coming your way since you are such a gift to us❤️

name: Kristin McGee
caption: When I was in my 20’s I remember attending my younger brother’s graduation dinner with my family. The desserts came and they were delicious; and I kind of went to town on them. Like I ate A LOT of each one. I couldn’t stop myself; and then afterwards I couldn’t stop beating myself up about it. The next morning I woke up and made myself run on the treadmill in the hotel room. I vowed not to eat that day and was literally crying over eating too much the night before. Instead of thinking about how much I enjoyed a night with my family. I am so sad that I did that to myself. I had an unhealthy relationship with food at that time. I think it was probably because I had an unhealthy relationship with myself and my body. I viewed things in extremes; and “all or nothing“ too often. I am only sharing this because maybe you can relate. It’s hard to not beat ourselves up. It’s hard to believe in ourselves and allow ourselves to feel centered and comfortable with who we are. When we lose touch with our inner guide, we can go to extremes, or find things to obsess about (food being one of them), or swallow our feelings.  I am really happy I am in a place where I can enjoy what I want to without worrying about it. I am more mindful and present with myself and less anxious about what I do or eat or say. I just wake up feeling pretty cozy in my body, mind and spirit. I am also more aware when I feel the need to fixate on things or find myself obsessing or spiraling into unhealthy thoughts or patterns. I definitely credit much of this to my 🧘🏼‍♀️ & meditation practice.  It’s a life long love affair with the person in the mirror. Not always easy but definitely always worth it. So if you woke up today with any guilty feelings or negative voices in your head; I ask you to take a deep breath, go for a walk, be really gentle with yourself. No matter your age, shape, height, you name it; life can be hard. It can also be so magical when we stop hating on ourselves and embrace ourselves with pure love. Drop a ❤️ below and let’s help each other feel this way too!!!

name: Kristin McGee
caption: ✨Tuesday Tip✨ Keeping your head in alignment! Foreword head syndrome is so common as we are often on our phones. (Believe me I’m trying to be on mine less and less!) Our heads are meant to be aligned with our spine.  Put your index finger on your chin and gently press your head back. It honestly feels so good!! It opens up our shoulders, aligns our heads with our hearts, and keeps us looking UP and and not down. What an awesome analogy for life!  Check in with yourself throughout the day - when you’re botht on and off the mat. Gently press your chin back into alignment and see how great it makes you feel! Tag a friend who could use this reminder for self care as well!  Happy Tuesday!

name: Kristin McGee
caption: ✨Mantra Monday-Gratitude ✨ When we soften our gaze and focus less on what’s wrong in our lives and more on what’s right, we can be thankful for all the little things that bring us joy.  When we stop comparing ourselves to others, and are content with what we have… we begin to live in the present which is truly the best gift there is! Write a gratitude list this week, call a friend or family member to say thank you and remember to tell yourself thank you for all that you do!  I AM GRATEFUL I AM HUMBLE I AM CONTENT Drop a 💙 if this resonates with you and tell me how you will practice gratitude today!  Today’s class is up OD!🙏🏻

name: Kristin McGee
caption: ✨Roll up✨ This is one of the more challenging Pilates exercises, but one of those that works the entire core! 🔥 We used a towel in today’s Pilates class  @onepeloton .  Try pulling the towel apart in your hands as you do half roll backs and then eventually full roll ups. It might help you find that scoop and make that roll up a little bit easier.  Drop a ❤️ if you took class today!  The playlist was friendship themed so tag a friend to let them know you’re thinking of them!!

name: Kristin McGee
caption: Peloton ROW is here!!! I had a blast rowing with  @katiewongspelledwang   @onepeloton .  We rowed with  @ashpryor_thatsme  and I loved it…time just flew by! Rowing is so much fun; and this rower is by far the best (I know I’m biased but it’s true 🙌 ). It’s form assist is awesome 😎  I love the way rowing complements yoga. name: Kristin McGee
caption: ✨Tuesday Tip✨ How do you flex your foot?  Today I want to cover how it’s important to flex at the ankle joint.  Often times, we just pull our toes back but it’s imperative we flex from the ankle joint. The more mobility we have in our ankle joint, the better off we are in so many ways. The next time you are in any sort of a forward fold or lying on your back, make sure to fully flex your ankles. PS Not only is Lucky photobombing my video, but do you see Timothy popping his head up in the background 🤣

name: Kristin McGee
caption: ✨Tuesday Tip ✨ Don’t tuck your butt!! So many times I find myself standing with this kind of posture.  My hips jut forward, my abdomen is relaxed and my hip flexors are shortened.  I would stand with my babies on each hip like this repeatedly; which was not the best for my diastasis nor my pelvic floor.  When you stand, try to keep a neutral pelvis.  Feel the engagement of the entire pelvic floor on an exhalation. Think of the back and front side lifting (my fav pilates teacher used to say “can of beans and double latte”). This is helpful for our posture, the strength of our glutes, and for rehabbing the pelvic floor and diastasis. Throughout the day, do a check to see if you are tucking under too often.  What would you like to see next?

name: Kristin McGee
caption: Marathon magic ✨🏃🏼‍♀️There was so much excitement in the air this weekend; and past week leading up to the NYC marathon.  I love the city this time of year with people coming from all over the world to share their joy of running! It is seriously so inspirational & fun.  I had the incredible opportunity of meeting some amazing people from Nina Kuscsik (one of the “six who sat” read up on this if you haven’t heard of it!) to Emily Sisson who just set a new record for an American woman at the Chicago marathon to Joan Benoit Samuelson the first women's Olympic Games marathon champion! She also held the fastest time for an American woman at the Chicago Marathon for 32 years after winning the race in 1985.  The boys and I went out to cheer on the runners; and today we are celebrating everyone we see wearing their medals. I personally have a love hate relationship with running. I’ve never been “great” at it.  My friend (who was responsible for all these great opportunities) said recently “that running is such a metaphor for life; you have so many reasons to just stop at any moment, but all you have to do is put one foot in front of the other to keep going.” I am 💯 running next year’s NYC marathon!!! Who’s joining me?

name: Kristin McGee
caption: Congrats to all who finished the NYC marathon today! 🏃🏼‍♀️ Here is one of my favorite restorative hamstring stretches that will help in your recovery.  Grab a yoga strap and make a long loop placing it around your foot and nape of your neck.  Stay in the pose for 8-10 deep breaths (or up to 2-3 minutes) and then switch legs. Play around with letting the leg fall open and across the body as well.  PS. How adorable is Robert?

name: Kristin McGee
caption: Who’s running the NYC marathon tomorrow?! Here’s a quick & easy flow I love to do pre (and post) 🏃🏼‍♀️. Also, a lovely way to greet the day ☀️! (one of my fav things to do every morning.) Tag a runner friend & good luck to everyone tomorrow!!! 🏃🏼‍♀️ Clasp hands backbend 🏃🏼‍♀️ Step back crescent lunge 🏃🏼‍♀️ Flow between kneeling hamstring & crescent 🏃🏼‍♀️ In crescent try lifting the knee (keep top of foot on floor awesome hip flexor quad and ankle stretch) 🏃🏼‍♀️ Tuck toes under to come to high lunge 🏃🏼‍♀️ Step forward hug knee to chest 🏃🏼‍♀️ Standing quad stretch Repeat opposite side ✨

name: Kristin McGee
caption: These two moves are probably my fav when it comes to core work! Bird dog & Dead bug both target the transverse abdominals (think inner corset) which stabilizes our spine and pelvis. Before we move our limbs, we want to feel strong in our core.  I love these as warm ups before any activity; as well as for anyone with diastasis or back issues. Make sure to maintain a neutral pelvis when performing these. Breathe deeply and aim for 4-6 reps 3 sets on a daily basis!  What’s your fav core move?

name: Logan Aldridge
caption: The obstacle is the way: rope has played a big role in my life, it’s why my left arm was amputated - boating accident with the ski rope getting wrapped around my arm. Rope has also been the catalyst to recognizing my potential and ability is greater than I knew. I believe the way we can discover more about our potential is through pursuing difficult physical efforts. When I first tried to climb a rope with one arm I didn’t think I could, when I made it to the top I knew I had exceeded my own expectation on what I thought I was capable of. Seek out difficult things to pursue and accomplish. It’s the best way to discover your highest ability, potential and self worth.  #rope #training

name: Logan Aldridge
caption: Vitality - the state of being strong and active; energy.  I think of vitality as the mind-body connection to resilience and aliveness. The word itself is derived from vita or “life”. Vitality was the theme of the corporate wellness event with Cigna last week and it got me thinking about this beautiful relationship between our bodies and minds and how we contribute to their development.  When we choose to pursue challenging workouts we’re strengthening our mental vitality just as much as the physical and the body knows it. I’ve never met someone who regrets having done a workout at the end of it - even if during it all you wanted to do was stop. We prove to our body and mind that pushing through the struggle/resistance is VITAL and on the other side is always exposed potential and gratitude. It’s what reminds our body and mind that it’s far more capable than it knows.  #vitality

name: Nico Sarani
caption: It’s Friday afternoon. Little Charie and little Nico jump into the Uber to the train station to head out of the city over the weekend.  It’s been raining outside aaall freakin’ day long, which is why C & N are both soaked, and why Nico is a little pissed. Her socks and shoes are wet, her pants are full of mud, and she mixed up the train times earlier on (which is a whole other story - let’s just say it didn’t lift her mood).  Not my favorite day ever, little Nico thinks.  C & N wiggle their butts into the car. Nico to Eduardo (Uber driver): This weather sucks.  Eduardo: Ooh why? It’s just a little rain. Nico: It just makes everything harder.  Eduardo: But it’s just rain. It comes and goes.  Nico: True. Could be worse.  Eduardo: Yeah, it could be cold outside. But it’s not. It’s just rain.  You’re headed out of the city? Weekend trip?  Nico: Yeah, off to the beach and out into nature.  Eduardo: Aah come on - that’s wonderful. And you’re complaining about the rain..! [Silence] Nico: You are a wise man, Eduardo. A very wise man. Nico and Charlie wobble out of the car. Smiles on their faces (yes, Charlie’s too, obv).  I hope y’all bump into your own Eduardo, just when you need it. #perspective  💜

name: Nico Sarani
caption: Just a little appreciation post…🎉unfortunately I don’t have recent pictures of all the people I love and giggle with, but just know that if you’re in my life, you’re definitely one of them ♥️.  I don’t think you always need to know people for a very long time to know that they’re your peeps. Sometimes you just hit it off right away. And even though I’ve come to love this city a hell lot, I’ve gotta say once again: It’s the people that make a place.  You all make me feel at home, no matter if you’re close or over there in Germany, no matter if I’ve known you forever, or if we bumped into each other recently.  That’s all. Much love and a monster hug ♥️

name: Rebecca Kennedy
caption: The Mobility Collection is here! Mobility is essential in a well rounded fitness routine and I am so excited to be able to share these classes with you. You’ll increase your range of motion and perform better in your next workout, and reach goals you never thought possible. Mobility is different than stretches and warmups - it’s a critical piece in a well rounded training program. It focuses on joints specifically to increase range of motion and movements with ease. Everyone needs mobility! Join me for a 15 minute Morning Mobility and a 20 min Hip Mobility! You’re going to LOVE these.  The more you do them, the more you’ll benefit- so bookmark these workouts add them to your weekly routine.

name: Robin Arzón
caption: @onepeloton ’s  @robinnyc  says December, often the busiest month of the year, is the perfect time to “reclaim our self-care and our movement back,” by taking part in a fitness challenge. She shares how “one intentional choice” each day can transform the next one.

name: Robin Arzón
caption: #3for31  is BACK! 🏃🏽‍♀️ Prioritizing this sacred time for myself in December is what helps keep me going during the holidays, into the new year, and beyond. This year, if you complete all 31 days in December, you can earn a spot on the pre-registration list to become a  #swaggersociety  club member. 👑 To get on my Swaggerlist  - Walk, run, or jog for 3 miles every day OR move for 30 minutes every day in December - Then, post your completed tracker at the end of the month on your Instagram feed or on Twitter with the hashtags  #3for31   #swaggersociety Note: IG Stories and Reels are not included for official challenge participation, but feel free to tag me there too as a bonus! Challenge ends on 12/31. All participants who complete the  #3for31  Challenge get to:- Join my Swaggerlist for a chance to become a member of  #SwaggerSociety - Join me for a live (virtual) event in January Need help keeping track of your  #3for31  progress?📸 Screenshot the calendar tracker graphic on slide 3 and check off each day you complete the challenge. 🗓️ Comment below if you're IN!  ⬇️

name: Robin Arzón
caption: Not every day is going to be your day, but I’m positive you’ll be more resilient at the end of a workout than when you started it. Consistency requires a long-term commitment. It builds confidence and trust in yourself because every time you honor a promise to yourself, the more likely you are to achieve your goals. I always say little by little amounts to a lot and while it might not feel like you're moving the needle much, over time you will see progress. If you’re struggling with motivation, I invite you to think about your WHY instead. WHY are you choosing to move your body day after day? The reason has to be bigger than yourself or any external gaze.  PS -  I’m doing a familiar challenge again next month that has a lot to do with this messaging. Any guesses? ⬇️ Official announcement coming soon. 👀

name: Robin Arzón
caption: Who’s traveling for Thanksgiving this year? ✈️🚗Here’s my annual PSA to let you know that it IS possible to get movement in when going out of town for the holidays. Video footage is from a vacation last year, making it WORK - even with a baby! 🤣 Pretty sure I was taking a core class with  @emmalovewell  🔥 See my tips for working out on the go, below.  Outdoor Runs & Walks: We have audio-only runs & walks available on the  @onepeloton  app. Queue one up and get out there. Exploring a new neighborhood or re-exploring your hometown can be fun, especially if you bring along a family member or an old friend.  Bodyweight Strength & Cardio: There are a ton of bodyweight strength classes on the App + classes you don’t need any equipment for such as Shadowboxing,  HIIT Cardio, Dance, Pilates, Barre, and Yoga. SO MANY OPTIONS, y’all. There really are zero excuses.   How are you moving this holiday weekend? ⬇️

caption: WE DON’T SHRINK FOR ANYONE OR ANYTHING. 🚫 I’m grateful I found someone who encourages me to shine in all ways.  @iamdrewbutler  has never encouraged me to shrink and that’s how I knew saying yes to our partnership was the right choice. Where are you at in your journey to self-love? 🫶🏽 ⬇️

name: Robin Arzón
caption: RITUALIZING DISCOMFORT. 🔥 When we ritualize discomfort, when we create a little mini right of passage of finishing the Tabata class or finishing the 30-minute run, whatever it is, it's a signal to our spirit, our psyche, our muscles, and to ourselves, that an adaptation is called for.  When we have enough of those adaptations, yes, we see the physical changes, but I care much more that people start to notice the confidence and bravery that ends up becoming a side effect of that work.  What’s a non-physical change you noticed in yourself after making movement a constant in your life? ⬇️

name: Tobias Heinze
caption: Team - eigentlich gibt es hierzu nicht viel zu sagen und andererseits doch. Der härteste Lauf meines Lebens… 6km bergauf - 1100hm - von 3800münN auf 4900münN. Liebevoll beschrieben als einer der höchsten Vertical k‘s der Welt. Von ist das schön hier, bis zum absoluten emotional und mentalem Zusammenbruch. Hier erlebst du dich ganz neu - unsere Manaslu Base Camp Etappe. ————————————————————- Team - actually there's not much to say about this, and yet there is. The hardest run of my life... 6km uphill - 1100m - from 3800m a.s.l. to 4900m a.s.l. Lovingly described as one of the highest vertical k's in the world. From it's beautiful here, to absolute emotional and mental breakdown. Here you experience yourself in a whole new way - our Manaslu Base Camp stage. . . . . . #itsTtime #basecamp #trailrunning #himalayas #nepal #mountains   #bhuddism

name: Tobias Heinze
caption: Team - mein erster Versuch euch dieses unglaubliche Erlebnis zu schildern. So waren die ersten 2,5 Tage - subtropisches Klima. Lange Etappen mit vielen Vertikal- und Höhenkilometern. Das sind Erinnerungen für ein ganzes Leben - so tolle Leute, so eine fantastische Natur und eine umwerfende Kultur! Enjoy the journey… —————————————————————————————— Team - my first attempt to describe this incredible experience to you. The first 2.5 days were like this - subtropical climate. Long stages with many vertical and altitude kilometres. These are memories for a lifetime - such great people, such fantastic nature and an amazing culture! Enjoy the journey... . . . . . . . . #itsTtime #trailrunning #nepal #himalayas #bhuddism #mountains #goprophotography   #drone   #timeofourlife

name: Tobias Heinze
caption: Reisen erweitert den Horizont. Neue Kulturen heben sich mental auf eine neue Ebene. Nepal ein Land voller rauher Gegebenheiten und ganz gegensätzlichen Menschen. Liebevolle, hilfsbereite Menschen - die schier unmögliches Tag für Tag leisten und dabei nach gutem Karma streben, welches sie durch gute Taten sammeln. Ohne Stress, ohne Neid oder Missgunst. Danke Nepal 🇳🇵  —————————————————————————————- Travelling broadens the horizon. New cultures lift you to a new level mentally. Nepal is a country full of harsh conditions and very contrasting people. Loving, helpful people - who do almost impossible things day after day and strive for good karma, which they collect through good deeds. Without stress, without envy or resentment. Thank you Nepal 🇳🇵  . . . . . #itsTtime #nepal #culture #stupa #bhuddism   #monastry #prayerflags   #trailrunning   #manaslu

name: Tobias Heinze
caption: Was für eine Reise! Wenn du an einem Tag anfängst nach oben zu laufen, wirst du die Magie erleben. Subtropisches Klima zu Beginn, weiter bis zum ersten Blick auf den Manaslu. Um dann endlich - nahe des Basecamps - in Mitten eines gewaltigen Gletschers, den Berg der Berge berühren zu können! Fantastisch 🗻 ———————————————— What a journey! If you start walking up one day, you will experience the magic. Subtropical climate at the beginning, further up to the first view of Manaslu. Then finally - near the base camp - in the middle of a huge glacier, you can touch the mountain of mountains! Fantastic🗻 . . . . . . . #itsTtime #manaslu #trail #trailrunning #himalayas   #nepal #bhuddism   #glacier   #mountains

name: Tobias Heinze
caption: Team - we did it! Es war wunderschön, einzigartig und brutal ehrlich. Wir starteten auf 800m ünN und stiegen auf, bis auf 5200m ünN. Wir lernten eine fremde Kultur kennen und verliebten uns. Wir lernten uns neu kennen und verliebten uns erneut. Ich werde euch soviel in der nächsten Zeit berichten. Hier und live auf dem Tread! —————————————— Team - we did it! It was beautiful, unique and brutally honest. We started at 800m a.s.l. and climbed up to 5200m a.s.l.. We got to know a foreign culture and fell in love. We got to know each other anew and fell in love again. I will tell you so much in the near future. Here and live on the tread! . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . #itsTtime   #nepal   #trailrunning   #trail #himalayas #manaslu #buddhism   #karma

name: Tunde Oyeneyin
caption: When I was writing my book Speak, I don’t think I fully understood how deeply my words, my stories, were going to resonate with you all. I wrote because I had something to say. Little did I realize, that I was writing to share a part of me that people needed to see the most. It’s been 7 months since Speak was published and this week it’s officially announced one of  @amazon ’s Best Books of 2022 in Business and Leadership, and  @audible ’s Best of 2022 in the Well-Being category. Thank you for taking my words and cherishing them as your own. Thank you for reading and being kind with my deepest thoughts. Thank you for shining the lessons back at me and reminding me to surrender, live in my power, lead with empathy, be authentic, and (understand) my knowledge.  Thank you to everyone who helped Speak come to life and who continue to support me as I write my next chapter. Thank you to my team,  @hilaryliftin  and everyone at  @avidreaderpress  &  @simonandschuster

name: Tunde Oyeneyin
caption: I have a lot of friends, but technology... isn’t one of them. Millennials, raise your hand if you agree 🙋🏿‍♀️ Good thing I have the  @pocket  app to help me be more intentional with my time. I recently downloaded it because I was sick of having to click around my phone looking through my text threads and emails, to see where I stashed whatever link I wanted to read, or listen to, or watch. Luckily, I can now save everything in one place.  See what I love most about it in my reel - I’ll share more soon - stay tuned!  #MyPocketStory   #ad

name: Peloton
caption: At the age of 28, professional soccer player and Peloton Member Melanie Leupolz ( @melanie_leupolz ) has already had a dream career - German Champion, European Champion and Olympic Champion. But most recently, she has been preparing for a completely different challenge with Peloton in becoming a mom-thlete. I absolutely feel like an independent woman and I'm confident that with the right support I can balance my career and family. // Eine Peloton Member Story mit Melanie Leupolz. Mit 28 Jahren hat die Profifußballerin bereits eine Traumkarriere hingelegt – Deutsche Meisterin, Europameisterin und Olympiasiegerin. Mit Peloton hat sie sich über die letzten Monate aber auf eine ganz andere Herausforderung vorbereitet. Seit September ist Melanie jetzt auch Mamathletin, also Profisportlerin und Mutter. „Ich fühl mich absolut als unabhängige Frau und bin zuversichtlich, dass ich mit der richtigen Unterstützung meine Karriere und die Familie unter einen Hut bekommen kann.” Wir sind uns ganz sicher, dass sie auch dieses Ziel erfolgreich meistern wird und sind jederzeit da, um sie auf ihrem Weg zu motivieren.

name: Ash Pryor
caption: What I love about rowing on the water and on land is the constant excitement to learn more about myself. For me “showing up” or “putting in the work” isn’t always about a PR or being the best. It’s believing that even in the struggle bus moments I will find a way to get to the end. Leaving me with a lesson, new coping skills, a new strategy, and/or reflection point.  The honesty I receive from that machine and the boat is unfiltered. It doesn’t care about my feelings, I just receive the truth. The biggest lesson I learned on the water that I bring on land is centering yourself. There are moments where the water is so choppy you’re like “why did I do this?”  “I can’t do this?”  “Oh shoot how do I get out of this?”  You have a choice to stop but then what? Or you can keep going, building momentum, and forging past the rough patch. And after awhile you adapt to the choppy water. It no longer is a barrier. So when it’s flat water you’re smooth sailing.  I don’t always have the perfect stroke and I am not always the fastest person on the water but I still keep showing up and putting in the work not for anyone else but me. I’m excited to share more of the lessons I’ve learned on the water in the studio with you all.  I can’t wait to master the choppy water with you 🫶🏾  Scenic coming soon… #missionbaysandiego

name: Ash Pryor

I am still a little in shock to see this article and so grateful for  @michellekmedia  and  @selfmagazine  for giving me a platform to share my journey to  @onepeloton  and nerd out about rowing.  Everyone talks about being ready. I don’t know that it’s about always feeling or being ready when big opportunities come, but instead knowing you are prepared with the knowledge and tools to figure it all out. I’m excited to be on this journey and step into our power together.  We shifting this bad boy!! 😜
